title: New: Shinies – Ennui
content:
After a rather raucous yet thoroughly enjoyable night in Brighton with Manchester darlings Shinies, it was obviously apparent as to why they’re one of the UK’s most exciting young bands; their friendship.

With inter-band brawls threatening to break out, elaborate plans involving onstage holograms and a mini-tour of the seaside town’s fish and chip shops, the night culminated in attempting to sneak four people into a two person hotel room, a plan that was quickly quashed by the hotel owners. Now with the tricky first 7″ out of the way, the four piece have returned with new single Ennui, another four minute plus pop song, complete with shoegaze influences, singalong choruses and a cutting wit – “dress me in your favourite dress, grow your hair down to your knees“, everyone loves a Shiny, and it’s all to easy to hear why.
